synthesis_conditions.TGA_curves: See Figure S6 in the Supporting Information

properties.temperature_dependence: conductivity could only be measured above 140 °C due to water solubility at higher RH

properties.proton_conductivity: increases by one order of magnitude above 120 °C, reaching a maximum value of 8.5 x 10^-5 S cm^-1 at 184 °C
decreases when temperature is increased, characteristic of vehicle mechanism
properties.conductivity_change: continuous but slow decrease in conductivity observed at 130 °C for more than 20 h

properties.proton_conductivity: remains constant upon increasing the temperature
properties.conductivity_value: 1.4 x 10^-6 S cm^-1, lowest among synthesized materials

properties.proton_conductivity: high and constant in solid state
properties.phase_separation: good phase separation providing high proton conduction at molecular level
